com.github.moribund.objects.playable

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.moribund.objects.playable.PlayableCharacter
      • com.github.moribund.objects.playable.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor, Drawable, Flaggable, Movable

    public class Player
extends PlayableCharacter
    The Player that is being controlled by a client. The Player is a type of InputProcessor for it is bound to keyBinds.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private it.unimi.dsi.fastutil.objects.ObjectSet<Flag> flags
      The currently active Flags on the Player.

      The currently active Flags on the Player that will soon be removed.
      private it.unimi.dsi.fastutil.ints.Int2ObjectMap<PlayerAction> keyBinds
      The respective Input.Keys that are bound to Runnable methods defined in this class.
      private static int MOVEMENT_SPEED 
      private int playerId
      The unique player ID based on the Connection of the client to the server.
      private static int ROTATION_SPEED 
      private com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Sprite sprite
      The Sprite of this Player that represents the Player in the live game visually.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(int playerId)
      Makes a Player with its unique player ID generated by the Connection between the client and the server.

      • flagsToRemove

        private it.unimi.dsi.fastutil.objects.ObjectSet<Flag> flagsToRemove
        The currently active Flags on the Player that will soon be removed. This is cleared whenever the respective flags have been removed from their ObjectSet.

      • touchDown

        public boolean touchDown(int screenX,
                         int screenY,
                         int pointer,
                         int button)
        Description copied from interface: com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor
        Called when the screen was touched or a mouse button was pressed. The button parameter will be Input.Buttons.LEFT on iOS.
        Parameters:
        screenX - The x coordinate, origin is in the upper left corner
        screenY - The y coordinate, origin is in the upper left corner
        pointer - the pointer for the event.
        button - the button
        Returns:
        whether the input was processed

      • touchUp

        public boolean touchUp(int screenX,
                       int screenY,
                       int pointer,
                       int button)
        Description copied from interface: com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor
        Called when a finger was lifted or a mouse button was released. The button parameter will be Input.Buttons.LEFT on iOS.
        pointer - the pointer for the event.
        button - the button
        Returns:
        whether the input was processed

        public boolean mouseMoved(int screenX,

      • scrolled

        public boolean scrolled(int amount)
        Description copied from interface: com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor
        Called when the mouse wheel was scrolled. Will not be called on iOS.
        Parameters:
        amount - the scroll amount, -1 or 1 depending on the direction the wheel was scrolled.
        Returns:
        whether the input was processed.
